page.title: 15Birdham - Chichester Canal
page.content: Part of the Portsmouth and Arun Canal runs through the parish of Birdham. The canal was opened in 1823. It ran from Portsmouth through the Chichester harbour to Birdham and then to the Arun. It was possible to travel then on to London. A branch of the canal went up to Chichester. The canal was finally abandoned in 1928. The seaward end of the canal is at Salterns Lock, a working lock which is in need of repair. The remains of another lock, Casher Lock, can still be seen but this is now a solid concrete weir. There is one swing bridge which still operates the Egremont Bridge. This section of the old canal is now used for mooring houseboats. Some of these boats move out into the harbour for the summer months.
